net.java.truevfs.comp.zip.crypto

Class CipherReadOnlyChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.java.truecommons.io.AbstractSeekableChannel
      • net.java.truecommons.io.DecoratingSeekableChannel
        • net.java.truecommons.io.ReadOnlyChannel
          • net.java.truevfs.comp.zip.crypto.CipherReadOnlyChannel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, ByteChannel, Channel, ReadableByteChannel, SeekableByteChannel, WritableByteChannel

    @NotThreadSafe
public final class CipherReadOnlyChannel
extends net.java.truecommons.io.ReadOnlyChannel
    Provides buffered random read-only access to the plain text of an encrypted file. Note that this channel maintains its own virtual file pointer.
    Author:
    Christian Schlichtherle
    See Also:
    CipherOutputStream

    • Constructor Detail

      • CipherReadOnlyChannel

        @CreatesObligation
public CipherReadOnlyChannel(SeekableBlockCipher cipher,
                                                @WillCloseWhenClosed
                                                SeekableByteChannel channel)
        Constructs a new cipher read-only channel.
        Parameters:
        cipher - the initialized, seekable block cipher.
        channel - the seekable byte channel.

      • CipherReadOnlyChannel

        @CreatesObligation
public CipherReadOnlyChannel(SeekableBlockCipher cipher,
                                                @WillCloseWhenClosed
                                                SeekableByteChannel channel,
                                                int bufferSize)
        Constructs a new cipher read-only channel.
        Parameters:
        cipher - the seekable block cipher.
        channel - the seekable byte channel.
        bufferSize - the size of the byte buffer. The value gets rounded down to a multiple of the cipher's blocksize or the cipher's blocksize, whatever is larger.

    • Method Detail

      • mac

        public byte[] mac(Mac mac)
           throws IOException
        Returns the authentication code of the encrypted data in this cipher read-only channel using the given Message Authentication Code (MAC) object. It is safe to call this method multiple times to detect if the file has been tampered with meanwhile.
        Parameters:
        mac - a properly initialized MAC object.
        Returns:
        A byte array with the authentication code.
        Throws:
        IOException - on any I/O error.
